snippet: Mikhail D. Prokhorov is showing his determination to win at any cost: a high-profile trade helped raise the Nets’ payroll to $101 million, triggering a luxury tax bill of about $82 million.
abstract: Russian billionaire Mikhail D Prokhorov, owner of the Brooklyn Nets, engages in high-profile trade that raises Nets’ payroll to $101 million, triggering a luxury tax bill of about $82 million; few NBA owners spend on their teams as eagerly as Prokhorov does, or with as much overt glee; he committed to $330 million in player contracts in summer 2012.
lead_paragraph: Mikhail D. Prokhorov is showing his determination to win at any cost: a high-profile trade helped raise the Nets’ payroll to $101 million, triggering a luxury tax bill of about $82 million.

headline.main: For Nets’ Prokhorov, $183 Million Is No Object
headline.print_headline: For N.B.A.’s Version of Steinbrenner, $183 Million Is No Object
